snippet: Feral pigs, known as eating machines in the South and West, are now troubling farms in New York’s Champlain Valley, devouring crops and prey.
abstract: Feral pigs have invaded upstate farms in New York’s Champlain Valley, devouring crops and prey; growing population's origin is generally unknown, although many theories exist; state officials, wildlife managers and researchers are exploring various control measures, from contraceptives to poisons and traps, as well as relaxing hunting rules for the swine.
lead_paragraph: Feral pigs, known as eating machines in the South and West, are now troubling farms in New York’s Champlain Valley, devouring crops and prey.

headline.seo: Feral Pigs Plaguing Upstate New York
headline.main: Wily, Elusive Foragers Invade Upstate New York
headline.print_headline: Wily, Elusive Foragers Invade Upstate New York
